Package sample.View_Controller

Class Inventory_mainController

java.lang.Object
sample.View_Controller.Inventory_mainController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class Inventory_mainController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This controller extends the main functionality to navigate to other controllers and set up the tableviews

    • SearchParts

      public void SearchParts()
      This method initializes the search function and returns the typed Parts input if found. Part G a: This function can result in a logical error where a user is not able to search for both products using name and id correctly. First,it can result in a number exception error,a return of the wrong item or no items,or cause the data not to be populated.To fix this - add a listener to the search_field to listen for changes ,initialise an empty observable array to hold the return values-This is helpful because searching with an part Id only returns a part and the tableview only accepts observable lists Then include the isNumeric function to determine whether the input is a digit or string so that we can use the appropriate functions. Check whether the search_field is empty to avoid the number exception error when trying to convert it to integer. To synchronize both part id and name - add the id to an observable list and return a specific item - The lookup part overloaded method returns a specific instance while the name returns a List.

    • isNumeric

      public static boolean isNumeric​(java.lang.String str)
      validates digit inputs.
      Parameters:
      str - - The value to be checked if numeric
      Returns:
      boolean
